questions.text: पवित्रता से विशेषण कौन सा बनेगा?
questions.explanation: पवित्रता एक संज्ञा है जिससे 'पवित्र' विशेषण बनता है। विशेषण वह शब्द है जो संज्ञा या सर्वनाम की विशेषता बताता है।

questions.text: पूर्ण विराम से कम देर तक रुकने पर कौन सा विराम चिन्ह लगता है?
questions.explanation: अर्धविराम (;) पूर्ण विराम से कम और अल्पविराम से अधिक देर रुकने के लिए प्रयोग होता है। यह दो वाक्यों के बीच संबंध दिखाता है।

questions.text: चौपाई के प्रत्येक चरण में कितनी मात्राएं होती हैं?
questions.explanation: चौपाई एक छंद है जिसके हर चरण में 16 मात्राएं होती हैं। यह तुलसीदास और अन्य कवियों द्वारा बहुत प्रयोग किया गया है।

questions.text: सभी स्वर कौन सी कैटेगरी में आते हैं?
options: तीनों में से कोई भी नहीं
questions.explanation: स्वर ध्वनियां सभी घोष होती हैं क्योंकि इनके उच्चारण में स्वर तंत्रियों में कंपन होता है। घोष का अर्थ है आवाज़ के साथ।

questions.text: अनिश्चयवाचक सर्वनाम कौन सा है?
questions.explanation: 'कुछ' अनिश्चयवाचक सर्वनाम है क्योंकि यह किसी अनिश्चित वस्तु या व्यक्ति का बोध कराता है। यह निश्चित रूप से किसी का संकेत नहीं करता।

questions.text: क्रिया के मूल रूप को क्या कहा जाता है?
questions.explanation: धातु क्रिया का मूल रूप है जिससे विभिन्न काल, वचन और पुरुष के अनुसार क्रिया के रूप बनाए जाते हैं। जैसे 'लिख्' धातु से लिखना, लिखता आदि।

questions.text: 'ना तीन में ना तेरह में' मुहावरे का अर्थ क्या है?
questions.explanation: यह मुहावरा किसी ऐसे व्यक्ति के लिए प्रयोग होता है जो किसी भी काम का नहीं है, कहीं भी फिट नहीं बैठता।

questions.text: 'इंदिरा जी एक बार पटना आई थी' में 'जी' कौन सा निपात है?
questions.explanation: 'जी' आदरबोधक निपात है जो सम्मान और आदर प्रकट करने के लिए प्रयोग होता है। यह व्यक्ति के नाम के साथ जुड़कर आदर दिखाता है।

questions.text: जो मांस नहीं खाता है, इसके लिए एक शब्द क्या होगा?
questions.explanation: निरामिष का अर्थ है जो मांस न खाए, शाकाहारी। 'निर' का अर्थ है 'बिना' और 'आमिष' का अर्थ है 'मांस'।

questions.text: शब्द के जिस रूप से एक या अनेक का बोध हो उसे क्या कहा जाता है?
questions.explanation: वचन से संख्या का पता चलता है कि कोई व्यक्ति या वस्तु एक है या अनेक। हिंदी में एकवचन और बहुवचन होते हैं।

questions.text: चतुर्भुज में कौन सा समास है?
questions.explanation: चतुर्भुज में बहुव्रीहि समास है। यह ब्रह्मा के लिए प्रयोग होता है जिसकी चार भुजाएं हैं। बहुव्रीहि में दोनों पद मिलकर तीसरे का बोध कराते हैं।

questions.text: चूहे का पर्यायवाची शब्द क्या है?
questions.explanation: 'खनक' चूहे का पर्यायवाची शब्द है। पर्यायवाची का अर्थ है समानार्थी शब्द जो एक ही अर्थ देते हैं।

questions.text: अखबार किस भाषा का शब्द है?
questions.explanation: 'अखबार' अरबी भाषा का शब्द है। हिंदी में कई अरबी, फारसी और उर्दू के शब्द प्रचलित हैं।

questions.text: द + अ + क + श + अ से कौन सा शब्द बनेगा?
questions.explanation: द्+अ+क्+श्+अ = दक्ष। यह वर्ण संयोजन से शब्द निर्माण का उदाहरण है। दक्ष का अर्थ है कुशल या योग्य।

questions.text: सुभद्रा कुमारी चौहान देश प्रेम की भावना को व्यक्त करने वाली क्या हैं?
questions.explanation: सुभद्रा कुमारी चौहान एक प्रसिद्ध कवयित्री थीं। 'झांसी की रानी' जैसी देशभक्ति की कविताएं लिखीं। कवयित्री स्त्रीलिंग शब्द है।

questions.text: 'उधों का लेना ना माधवों का देना' का अर्थ क्या है?
questions.explanation: यह मुहावरा 'अपने काम से काम रखना' के अर्थ में प्रयोग होता है। किसी के साथ लेन-देन न होना।

questions.text: छंद का सर्वप्रथम उल्लेख कहां मिलता है?
questions.explanation: छंद का सबसे पहला उल्लेख ऋग्वेद में मिलता है। छंद का अर्थ है लय और ताल के साथ काव्य रचना।

questions.text: जिस काव्य में समान शब्द के अलग-अलग अर्थों में आवृत्ति हो वहां कौन सा अलंकार होता है?
questions.explanation: अनुप्रास अलंकार में समान वर्णों की आवृत्ति होती है। जब एक ही वर्ण बार-बार आता है तो वह अनुप्रास कहलाता है।

questions.text: निम्नलिखित में से किस शब्द में प्रत्यय लगा हुआ है?
questions.explanation: 'जादूगर' में 'गर' प्रत्यय है। प्रत्यय वे शब्दांश हैं जो मूल शब्द के अंत में जुड़कर नया अर्थ देते हैं।

questions.text: जंगल में लगने वाली आग को क्या कहते हैं?
questions.explanation: जंगल में लगने वाली आग को 'दावाग्नि' या 'दावानल' कहते हैं। यह प्राकृतिक आपदा का रूप है।

questions.text: प्रेरणार्थक क्रिया के कितने रूप होते हैं?
questions.explanation: प्रेरणार्थक क्रिया के दो रूप होते हैं - प्रथम प्रेरणार्थक और द्वितीय प्रेरणार्थक। जैसे पढ़ना-पढ़ाना-पढ़वाना।

questions.text: संज्ञा और सर्वनाम शब्द कैसे हैं?
questions.explanation: संज्ञा और सर्वनाम विकारी शब्द हैं क्योंकि इनमें लिंग, वचन, कारक के अनुसार रूप परिवर्तन होता है।

questions.text: स्मरण का विलोमार्थी शब्द क्या है?
questions.explanation: 'स्मरण' का विलोम 'विस्मरण' है। विलोम का अर्थ है विपरीत अर्थ वाला शब्द। स्मरण यानी याद करना, विस्मरण यानी भूल जाना।

questions.text: 'राम अयोध्या से वन को गए' इस वाक्य में 'से' किस कारक का बोधक है?
questions.explanation: 'से' अपादान कारक का चिह्न है जो अलगाव या जुदाई का बोध कराता है। यहां राम अयोध्या से अलग होकर वन में गए।

questions.text: 'मैं आप चला जाऊंगा' इस वाक्य में 'आप' कौन सा सर्वनाम है?
questions.explanation: यहां 'आप' निजवाचक सर्वनाम है जो 'स्वयं' के अर्थ में प्रयुक्त हुआ है। निजवाचक सर्वनाम अपनेपन का भाव दिखाता है।

questions.text: Identify the correctly spelled word: 'sarmon'
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is 'sermon' which means a religious discourse.

questions.text: Identify the correct spelling of 'resilience'
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is 'resilience' meaning the capacity to recover quickly from difficulties.

questions.text: Identify the correct spelling of 'souvenir'
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is 'souvenir' meaning a keepsake or memento.

questions.text: Convert the sentence to passive voice: 'I hope to win the medal'
options: It is hoped that the medal will be won by me
The medal is hoped to be won by me
I am hoped to win the medal
It is hope that the medal will be won by me
questions.explanation: The correct passive form changes the subject-object relationship and uses 'it is hoped that...' construction.

questions.text: Convert the imperative sentence to passive: 'Hate none'
questions.explanation: Imperative sentences starting with verbs convert to passive using 'Let + object + be + past participle'.

questions.text: Fill in the blank: 'How ___ you enter my room'
questions.explanation: 'How dare you' is the correct expression showing indignation at someone's boldness.

questions.text: Complete the sentence: 'Walk fast ___ you miss the train'
questions.explanation: 'Lest' is used to indicate something should be avoided, typically followed by 'should'.

questions.text: Change the gender: 'Louse' (female)
questions.explanation: The female form of 'louse' is 'lice', though this is actually the plural form in modern usage.

questions.text: What is the feminine of 'wizard'?
questions.explanation: The feminine counterpart of 'wizard' is 'witch'.

questions.text: Collective noun for bees flying together
questions.explanation: A group of bees in flight is called a 'swarm', while a settled group is a 'hive' or 'colony'.

questions.text: Superlative degree of 'out'
questions.explanation: The superlative form is 'utmost', meaning to the greatest extent or degree.

questions.text: Antonym of 'astonishment'
questions.explanation: While 'astonishment' means great surprise, its opposite would be 'expectation' (something anticipated).

questions.text: Antonym of 'lewd'
questions.explanation: 'Lewd' means crude and offensive in a sexual way, so its opposite is 'modest'.

questions.text: Antonym of 'harness'
questions.explanation: To 'harness' means to utilize or control, so its opposite is 'neglect' (fail to utilize).

questions.text: Synonym of 'repulsive'
questions.explanation: 'Repulsive' means causing intense dislike, with synonyms being 'disgusting' and 'revolting'.

questions.text: Synonym of 'devoted'
questions.explanation: 'Devoted' means very loving or loyal, with synonyms being 'dedicated' and 'loyal'.

questions.text: Synonym of 'confide'
questions.explanation: To 'confide' means to tell someone a secret privately, with 'confess' being a close synonym.

questions.text: Fill the preposition: 'The country is ___ peace'
questions.explanation: The correct phrase is 'in peace' meaning not at war or in a peaceful state.

questions.text: Fill the preposition: 'There is disagreement ___ these two friends'
questions.explanation: 'Between' is used for two items/people, while 'among' is for more than two.

questions.text: Complete the comparative degree: 'He is taller ___ me'
questions.explanation: Comparative adjectives are followed by 'than' when making comparisons.

questions.text: Complete the proverb: 'Look ___ you leap'
questions.explanation: The complete proverb is 'Look before you leap' meaning think carefully before acting.

questions.text: Correct the sentence: 'She is best singer in our class'
options: She is the best singer in our class
She is a best singer in our class
She is best singer in our class
She is bestest singer in our class
questions.explanation: Superlative adjectives like 'best' require the definite article 'the'.

questions.text: Fill the article: 'She has ___ unique idea'
questions.explanation: Although 'unique' starts with a vowel letter, it begins with a consonant sound (/j/), so 'a' is correct.

questions.text: Convert to reported speech: 'She says, 'I shall do my duty''
options: She says that she will do her duty
She says that I shall do my duty
She said that she would do her duty
She says that she shall do her duty
questions.explanation: When the reporting verb is in present tense, we don't change the tense in reported speech. 'I' changes to 'she' and 'my' to 'her'.

questions.text: Convert to reported speech: 'He said, 'Alas! I have failed''
options: He exclaimed with sorrow that he had failed
He said alas that he has failed
He exclaimed that alas he had failed
He said that he had failed alas
questions.explanation: Exclamatory sentences with 'Alas!' convert to 'exclaimed with sorrow' in reported speech, and present perfect changes to past perfect.

questions.text: What is 15 + 25?
What is 12 × 8?
Which country joined BRICS as a full member in January 2025?
questions.explanation: As per recent developments, Indonesia joined BRICS as a full member in January 2025.

questions.text: When was the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) established?
questions.explanation: The India Meteorological Department was established in 1875, making it one of the oldest meteorological services in the world.

questions.text: Who appoints the Chairman of the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC)?
questions.explanation: The President of India appoints the UPSC Chairman as per Article 316 of the Indian Constitution.

questions.text: In which state is Kandla Port located?
questions.explanation: Kandla Port is located in the Kutch district of Gujarat and is one of India's major ports on the west coast.

questions.text: Which state won the 33rd Santosh Trophy in 2025?
questions.explanation: West Bengal won the 33rd edition of the Santosh Trophy, India's premier football tournament, in 2025.

questions.text: When is National Girl Child Day celebrated in India?
questions.explanation: National Girl Child Day is celebrated annually on 24th January to promote awareness about girls' rights and education.

questions.text: What is the study of bones called?
questions.explanation: Osteology is the scientific study of bones, their structure, and function.

questions.text: When was the Shimla Conference held?
questions.explanation: The Shimla Conference was held in June-July 1945 to discuss the Wavell Plan for Indian self-government.

questions.text: Who is the author of 'The Great Rebellion'?
questions.explanation: 'The Great Rebellion' about the 1857 revolt was written by Indian historian Ashok Mehta.

questions.text: Which vitamin is essential for blood clotting?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K is essential for the synthesis of proteins required for blood coagulation.

questions.text: When did the Panjhautha farmers' movement occur in Sirmaur?
questions.explanation: The Panjhautha farmers' movement in Sirmaur, Himachal Pradesh occurred in 1942 against oppressive land revenue policies.

questions.text: Who won the ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2024?
questions.explanation: Australia won the ICC Women's T20 World Cup 2024, continuing their dominance in women's cricket.

questions.text: Who discovered cells?
questions.explanation: Robert Hooke discovered cells in 1665 while examining cork under a microscope.

questions.text: In which district is the Atal Cricket Stadium located?
questions.explanation: The Atal Cricket Stadium is located in Hamirpur district of Himachal Pradesh.

questions.text: As Chief Justice of India, which number judge was Sanjeev Khanna?
questions.explanation: Justice Sanjeev Khanna served as the 51st Chief Justice of India.

questions.text: How many princely states were merged to form Himachal Pradesh on 15 April 1948?
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh was formed by merging 30 princely states in 1948.

questions.text: On which river is the Largi Hydroelectric Project built?
questions.explanation: The Largi Hydroelectric Project is located on the Beas river in Kullu district.

questions.text: From which plant is the malaria drug quinine obtained?
questions.explanation: Quinine, used to treat malaria, is derived from the bark of the Cinchona tree.

questions.text: Which city will host the 2028 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Los Angeles will host the 2028 Summer Olympics, marking its third time hosting the Games.

questions.text: Which articles of the Indian Constitution relate to the Right to Equality?
questions.explanation: Articles 14-18 of the Indian Constitution guarantee the Right to Equality.

questions.text: Who was the first Governor of Himachal Pradesh?
questions.explanation: Shri S. Chakravarti served as the first Governor of Himachal Pradesh after it became a union territory in 1951.

questions.text: How many members does Himachal Pradesh have in the Lok Sabha?
questions.explanation: Himachal Pradesh has 4 Lok Sabha constituencies.

questions.text: Where are the Rocky Mountains located?
questions.explanation: The Rocky Mountains are a major mountain range in western North America.

questions.text: When was NITI Aayog established?
questions.explanation: NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India) replaced the Planning Commission and was established on 1 January 2015.

questions.text: Who is the current Foreign Secretary of India (as of 2025)?
questions.explanation: As of 2025, Vikram Misri serves as India's Foreign Secretary, the senior-most position in the Indian Foreign Service.
